title: Urban Design Brief 200 Dundas Street South, Cambridge
subject: urban planning
description: This Urban Design brief has been prepared as part of the complete Official Plan Amendment and Zoning By-Law Amendment applications for the proposed development and provides an overview of proposed design of the building and how it conforms to the planning policy, zoning, and urban design framework applicable to the property, including the City of Cambridge Official Plan Urban Design Policies. [...] The proposed building is oriented to the front of the front of the property with parking behind and mostly screen by the building which will improve the streetscape views. [...] 5.9 Accessibility / Universal Design 5.9.1 Development will be consistent with the The proposed development standards and regulations of the conforms to the standards and Accessibility for Ontarians with regulations of the AODA 2005 and Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario the Ontario Building Code. [...] 5.9.2 Accessible features will be well- The proposed development integrated within the function and design conforms to the standards and of sites and continuous barrier-free regulations of the AODA 2005 and access will be provided to buildings and the Ontario Building Code. [...] 5.11.2 The design and layout of surface parking The proposed development features will consider the following: parking spaces that are located at the rear of the building, as well as a) location to the rear or side of the underground.
relation: $$Cdata_source$$VNorth American City Reports POCO_POCC_ALL$$QNorth American City Reports
